c74object.name: flowSwing.subDiv
c74object.digest: Non Integer subdivision of a phasor
c74object.description: Subdivides an input phasor ramp into segments with any relative length.
c74object.discussion:
FlowSwing Overview
FlowSwing is based on Non-Isochronous (NI) Grids. It re-shapes control signals and the timing of sequences through flexible, dynamic timing structures that go beyond traditional meter. At its core, FlowSwing uses a small number of parameters to define grids generated by morphing between two isochronous pulses. These Non-Isochronous Grids are made of two beat durations (Short and Long), distributed as evenly as possible over a cycle, that can be dynamically modulated during performance.
flowSwing.subDiv is part of the FlowSwing package.

inlet.description: Each value in the list represents the relative time of a segment boundary in the range [0-1]. The length of the list determines the number of segments.
sliding factor for smoothing the step values.Positive value. Default is 0 (no sliding).

digest.p: middle inlet: Sets the times of segment boudnaries in the range [0-1]. The length of the list determines the number of segments.
middle inlet: clears the segment list. Phasor input is passed to the ouput unaltered
right inlet: linear interpolation factor for segment values. The list of semgment values is smoothed from the current values to the new values.
